Reading Bruker OPUS binary files in R

Philipp Baumann

2023-03-26

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd

Bruker instruments produce a proprietary file format to store all measurement parameters, configurations, environmental conditions, and spectral data types saved. The Bruker OPUS software does the measurements and produces thhe OPUS binary files.

Our package can read thosee binary files for most of the Fourier-Transform(FT)-Infrared(IR)-spectrometers from Bruker Optics GmBH.

Reading many OPUS files 

library("opusreader2")
file <- opus_file()
data_list <- read_opus(file)

read_opus is a list-parser using S3 classes. The data is arranged as shown in the Bruker OPUS viewer:

names(data_list)
#> NULL
